name: Channelheart
description: Sting spells get +20 Magic Power.
lore: Before the Edge Priory became the reclusive group they are now, they would channel their energy into steel lockets that could be worn by their Awoken Hollow protectors, allowing the Hollows to gain more strength at the cost of their longevity.

name: Cursed Vines
description: At start of turn, add a Vine Grasp spell with Ephemeral to your hand.
lore: Not all of the Edge Priory endeavors have been successes. Their attempts to return to the physical form of an Animus have been met with countless failures. The vines they’ve used in these experiments wither with the unstable energy that’s cursed them.

name: Emblem of the Exiles
description: At start of turn, the front friendly unit on each floor gains +15 Health.
lore: Wyldenten speaks in these visions of the Exiles’ purpose to forestall the Divinities desertion and avoid Armageddon. This history has been lost to time, it seems, as we’ve only created this new destruction ourselves.

name: Gnarled Root
description: Friendly units get +1 Attack per stack of Spikes.
lore: The roots of the Wildwood spread farther than just their own Ring, but the farther they travel from the center of the wood, the more likely they are to wither and die.

name: Petrified Crucible
description: Spikes deal +1 damage per stack.
lore: A tool made of petrified Wildwood bark, used to heat ores into something stronger. Used by the Edge Priory to create armor for their Hollows, a process that astounds me still.

name: Priory’s Cloak
description: When a friendly unit is healed, deal damage to the front enemy unit equal to the amount healed.
lore: A cloak gifted to me from a Channeler of the Edge Priory. It still contains some residual energy from its owner, allowing anyone who wears it to heal their wounds more effectively. Though this energy is not without side effects...

name: Rootsplit Mask
description: Apply Rooted to enemy units when they enter the floor below the Pyre Room.
lore: Breaking through their armor is considered a rite of passage for the Awoken, marking their shift from Hollow to Animus. This old armor breaks under the weight of new vines making up the Animus.

name: Sap Tap
description: The first time each turn a friendly unit is healed, draw 1.
lore: Intruders often try to tap the Wildwood to harvest its sap, though the Wildwood usually ends up harvesting the intruders instead. The Edge Priory has allowed me to collect these taps for my own personal research.

name: The Bloating Fungus
description: Regen restores +1 health per stack.
lore: This fungal infection affects the bark of trees throughout the Wildwood. While it feeds on much of the sap the tree produces, the fungus also accelerates the tree’s sap production entirely, creating a fascinating symbiotic relationship between the two species.

name: Thorn Casing
description: Sting spells get +10 Magic Power and Piercing.
lore: Using the smithing techniques I taught them, the Edge Priory developed casings for the thorns ejected from the Awoken, turning them into much deadlier weapons against the Winged.

name: Thornfruit
description: At start of turn, add a Sting spell to your hand.
lore: After a thorn has lodged into the ground and released its spores, it will wilt and return to the Wildwood. On very rare occasions, the thorn will produce a fruit that is coveted among Channelers, though I find it personally much too sour.

name: Ancient Pinion
description: When an Angel moves it gains Valor 2.
lore: The fossil of a great winged beast from which it is said all angels descend from. Question is, what was it doing in the last circle of Hell?

name: Blood of the Apex
description: Permanently add +2 Attack to a unit's Equipment on Slay.
lore: “Feed me,” hissed the sword. For the blade craved blood and would not be sated until its steel was fed.

name: Burning Feather
description: When a friendly unit dies, Angels on the floor gain Rage 7.
lore:
“I once wore this with pride. Now, I cannot bear to look at it.”
—Finna the Doomed

name: Captain's Halo
description: At start of turn, friendly units gain Valor 2 if they are at the front of the room.
lore: While the aristocrats of the Empyrial Palace inherit their crowns, within the ranks of the Banished they are earned.

name: Celestial Cascade
description: When a friendly unit gains Valor, it gains +1 stacks.
lore: “When I fled Heaven, I did not leave empty handed,” said Talos. She overturned the jar. Fel gasped. Celestial gems, each containing enough power to smite an army, tumbled onto the table.

name: Chain of the Valkyrie
description: When you equip an Angel, apply Valor 3, Rage 3, and Regen 3.
lore: The iron chain of an Empyrial Palace guard, taken in battle and now used by the Banished.

name: Karmic Censer
description: Shift triggers an additional time.
lore: “Why does this smell like chocolate?” asked Fel. “What’s chocolate?” asked Talos.

name: Martyr's Signet
description: At the end of the entire battle, friendly units at the front of the floor permanently gain +6 Health.
lore: A ring that belonged to Finna the Doomed. May it bring greater luck to whoever now wears it.

name: Radiant Arms
description: When you equip a unit, apply Damage Shield 1.
lore:
“Can you make it match my wings? I have to think about my brand.”
—Talos

name: Skysong Trumpet
description: Summoning a Hymnist applies Valor 5 to friendly units.
lore: Taken from a fallen guard of Heaven’s Maw, the Deathmetal Hymnist is now learning to play this rockin’ horn.

name: Titan's Edict
description: Valor grants an additional +1 Armor per stack.
lore: A slab of stone bearing a language long forgotten. The claw marks, however, seem much newer than the age of the stone would grant.

name: Ashes of the Fallen
description: Summon triggers an additional time.
lore: According to the Hellhorned, the dead are never really gone. Their remains are cremated and used as warpaint to imbue warriors with great strength and remind them of their eventual return to the ground.

name: Collection of Tails
description: Rage does not decay on friendly units.
lore: An imp officially matures into a demon when their tail falls off and they learn to stand on their own feet, but this evolution only seems to enrage the demon further. I don’t like the sight of the disembodied tails, but keeping them is necessary.

name: Consumed Crown
description: Friendly units gain +3 Attack on Slay.
lore: When a Hellhorned defeats another in battle, they will break off the loser’s horns and add it to their collection, forming them into a crown. I’ve learned the hard way that asking to wear another’s crown is considered incredibly rude.

name: Grrrg’s Goad
description: Demon units get Multistrike 1.
lore: Though credited with building the Hellhorned’s section of the Rail, Grrrg wasn’t able to complete it without help from other demons. Some needed more motivation than others.

name: Imp-cicle
description: At start of turn, add a random Imp unit to hand.
lore: When Seraph shattered our Hell Pyre and Hell froze over, many unsuspecting imps were caught in the ice. Taken aboard the Boneshaker, the Pyre shard slowly melts them free.

name: Queen’s Tail
description: When you summon your first Imp unit each turn, gain 1 Ember and draw 1.
lore: From what I can gather, the Queen had the only full-grown Demon tail in existence. Yet, in the visions I’ve spent with her, this tail has been replaced by her Shardsoul tail. Did this replacement grant the Hellhorned the ability to cycle, making them immortal? It’s as if a large shadow looms over any memory I should have of these Exiles...

name: Railhammer
description: When a friendly unit gains Armor, it gains +4 stacks.
lore: Railhammers have been forged in the deep pits of the Scorched Plains since the founding of our Covenant, making them durable tools in the construction of Hellhorned armor.

name: Resonant Shard
description: Rage adds an additional +1 Attack per stack.
lore: I modified the Pyre so that the sound it makes when it is threatened can no longer be heard by any creature, in Heaven or in Hell. However, an unintended consequence has been observed: distant Pyre shards will resonate with the same frequency and vibrate wildly, sometimes even shattering.

name: Scorched Steel
description: Friendly units enter with Armor 5.
lore: Steel hammered in the heat of the Scorched Plains is easily recognized by its banding. After the freeze, the steel became in short supply, but I’ve still been able to stockpile a small amount for defensive enhancements.

name: Scorching Restraints
description: Friendly units enter with Rage 3.
lore: For the Hellhorned that are considered too violent by their own clan’s standards, imprisonment is a cruel affair. Subjected to rot in chains sunk directly into the bubbling lava below, the prisoners are burned by the molten steel that binds them... and the scorching heat only enrages them further.

name: The Unbroken Horn
description: Conserve Ember between turns.
lore: I’ve never found the final whereabouts of Grrrg, but before his mysterious disappearance, he left his unbroken horn with the Hellhorned, leading me to believe he has succumbed to death.

name: Advanced Growth
description: When an equipped unit dies, permanently add +4 Attack to their Equipment.
lore: This bottle certainly gives off mixed messages. Between the skull and the note with the instructions ‘Eat Me,’ it’s unclear what you’re supposed to do.

name: Catalyzing Agent
description: At end of turn, Unstable increases by 5.
lore:
“I’m not sure what it does except that it does have a wonderful and fresh minty flavor.”
—from Dr. Orechi’s notebook

name: Contingency Plans
description: Monstrosities enter with Spikes 7.
lore:
“The effects of grafting body parts to creatures of opposite demonic species often results in surprising abilities.”
—from Dr. Orechi’s notebook

name: Frenzystesia
description: The first time each turn a friendly unit is equipped, gain 1 Ember.
lore:
“The doctor’s latest experiment has made all the subjects frenzy. And made me have a migraine.”
—Hugo, assistant to Dr. Orechi

name: Hair of the Hybrid
description: Equipping a friendly unit under half health applies Armor 10, otherwise it applies Rage 5.
lore:
“When hair strands are powdered, mixed, and then ingested, the resulting mixture has shown promise in energizing my subjects.”
—from Dr. Orechi’s notebook

name: Inga’s Beaker
description: Increase the number of choices when using Mix by 1.
lore: A forgotten piece of equipment collecting dust in the corner of Dr. Orechi’s lab. Once used by a renowned researcher not soon forgotten, the unknown liquid inside still bubbles from time to time.

name: Life Insurer
description: Friendly units gain Armor 14 on reviving with Reanimate.
lore:
“My experiments are not only of the scientific sort. I also enjoy dabbling in more fashionable pursuits. This piece from my fall line is functional and stylish!”
—from Dr. Orechi’s notebook

name: Nefarious Overflow
description: Unstable explosions deal twice as much damage.
lore:
“I spilled this mixture and let me say, the result was not pleasant.”
—Hugo, assistant to Dr. Orechi

name: Part Factory
description: On Deployment Phase, add a random Graft unit to your hand.
lore:
“The craftsman approach is no more! Time to use an assembly line to create my monsters.”
—from Dr. Orechi’s notebook

name: Progress Pacemaker
description: The first time you Mix each turn, Mix again.
lore:
“All my experiments do take a toll on the cardiovascular system of my assistants. This will fix that.”
—from Dr. Orechi’s notebook

name: Surgeon's Suture
description: Equipping a friendly unit restores them to full health.
lore:
“In just a snip, tuck, and solder, one soldier’s limb can be put onto another.”
—from Dr. Orechi’s notebook

name: Astrologer’s Orrery
description: The first time each turn it becomes Full Moon gain 1 Ember.
lore:
“Hmm... I see a malicious moon is coming in your star chart. A few gold coins and I might see how you can avoid this calamity.”
—Astrologer for the Luna Coven

name: Celestial Sails
description: On Deployment Phase, draw a non-damage spell from your deck. It costs -1 Ember.
lore:
“After the Fall, I searched the wreckage of our moon and found this sail. I remembered how the flightless fae used to play with these in the wind.”
—Ardania the Forbidden

name: Circle of Cycles
description: Restore 10 health to the lowest health friendly unit on Mooncycle.
lore:
“Oh, Empress Moon, you had one eye but so many faces!”
—Lady Ekka

name: Crystalized Wing
description: When you play a spell that would Ascend or Descend a unit, also apply Spell Weakness 1.
lore: Nestled in the sand where it had fallen from the skies, lay the wing of Arduhn’s youngest sister. And encasing his dear sister’s wing, a crystal made from the magic of her killer.

name: Fae’s Nook
description: Fae gain Conduit 1 and +5 Attack on Mooncycle.
lore: “Psst! Can you pass me some stardust treats? We’re running low in here!”

name: Kingdom's Tears
description: Increases healing from spells by 10.
lore:
“When the Titans destroyed our home, they shattered our moon into tiny fragments. This vial contains the last of our home.”
—Arduhn, twin brother of Lady Ekka

name: Lunar Lantern
description: Selene units get +20 Attack during Full Moon. Silent units get +20 Attack during New Moon.
lore: A lantern that illuminates depending on the phase of the moon.

name: Moonstone
description: At end of turn, if it is Full Moon, spells in hand gain +10 Magic Power.
lore:
“Take this stone, marked by Ekka’s blessing, and place it outside when the moon is full. You will always have a piece of the moon’s protection with you wherever you go.”
—The Ritual Tome

name: Razorthin Crescent
description: Mageblade adds an additional +1 Attack per stack.
lore: A blade carved from the moon itself and so thin that it cannot be seen, apart from when it gleams in the moonlight.

name: Seer Orb
description: When applying Spell Weakness, apply 1 more.
lore:
“I’ll keep my moon here until the time is right. Until then, you’ll whisper to me, won’t you?”
—Lady Ekka

name: Silent Sigil
description: When it becomes New Moon, apply Armor 10 to friendly Silent units.
lore: A banner torn from the ancient temple of the Luna Coven. The fae hope that one day they can hang this cloth once more.

name: Stardust Treat
description: The first unit you summon each turn gains Conduit 4.
lore: A tasty treat made of stardust, the coven love to take a pause when the moon is half full and eat these with tea.

name: Combustible Wax
description: When a friendly unit gains Burnout, it gains +3 stacks.
lore: Created for more urgent circumstances, the Wickless granted me this bomb for an emergency supply of wax on detonation. Having no need for it, I ended up giving it to the Waxers to increase their chances of survival.

name: Encased Ember
description: Gain 5 Ember when a Tomb unit dies.
lore: It seems that throughout the existence of the Waxen Arches, everything has fallen victim to wax encasement. Not even the Ember of the Pyre has been spared, though I’ve collected any I’ve seen trapped to free them again later.

name: Exploding Candle
description: Deal 5 damage to enemy units when a Burnout unit dies.
lore: When Flicker decided to help me unite the Ring and build the Rail, he lit a ceremonial candle to commemorate the event. Appropriately, the current state of the candle reflects the state of the Covenant it was created to represent.

name: Fade’s First Blade
description: Friendly units gain Rage 3 whenever they lose a stack of Burnout.
lore: I should no longer be surprised by Fade’s unusual nature. Her lack of wax dates her long before the creation of the Waxers and the Wickless, and the wicks atop her head seem to be purely ornamental. Yet the knife she carries and the “code” that she lives by, or lack thereof, has many similarities to the Remnant of today.

name: Flicker’s Liquor
description: When you play a unit after Deployment, a random card in hand is reduced to 0 Ember until played or discarded.
lore: Flicker has been known to imbibe on occasion, and when he can’t find me to drink with him, he’ll corner unlucky Waxers who quickly succumb to its effects.

name: Melting Spout
description: Tomb units get +30 Health and Burnout 1.
lore: Only the wealthiest of Waxers can afford the portable melting pot I created to allow on-demand wax guttering. Out of charity, unfortunate Tombs are given a spout by the Reformed so they can survive.

name: Memorial Fund
description: Gain 5 Gold when a friendly unit dies.
lore: In a scheme I refused to take part in, Flicker devised a plan to collect funds from Waxers to benefit those who have passed, only to keep them for himself.

name: Mold Braces
description: Friendly units apply Armor 5 to the front friendly unit on Extinguish.
lore: Not all who enter the mold do so willingly. The need for restraints, while I consider it cruel, has been effective in solidifying these ‘participants’ will to reform or, sometimes, to melt for the sake of others.

name: Resin Block
description: When a friendly unit dies, apply +10 Attack to that unit.
lore: With each melt and reform comes the development of new resin, giving the Waxer a particular edge they didn’t have in their previous life. I’ve chipped some away to study further once aboard the Boneshaker.

name: Votive Key
description: Apply Endless to the first friendly unit played each turn.
lore: Keys to Votive Houses have secretly circulated in Waxer communities for eons, with new copies being made all the time to evade detection of the original thief. Having come across a couple in my travels, I’ve kept them for myself in case the need for one arises.

name: Waxer Snuffer
description: Extinguish triggers an additional time.
lore: For the less committed Wickless enthusiasts who are unwilling to remove their wick entirely, the snuffer provides a glimpse into a possible wick-free life. I’ve helped some Waxers dim their flames, though most prefer to do it themselves.

name: Attuned Manacles
description: Summoning a Whelp reduces Cooldown of friendly units by 1.
lore: For the Pyreborne who desire to lead lives governed by love and joy instead of gold, their fate lies in imprisonment. They are left to tend to Fhyra’s temple and never seen again.

name: Ember Charge
description: On your first turn, +2 Ember.
lore: Although an ember won’t be able to offer much energy, it’s enough to spark a keg of Pyregel or two.

name: Expanded Coffers
description: Increase max Dragon's Hoard by 3.
lore:
You can learn a lot about a dragon by how much gold is in their coffers.
—old Pyreborne adage

name: Fhyra’s Breath
description: Whelps apply Pyregel 3 on Strike.
lore: Visitors of Fhyra’s temple can buy cute charms at the gift shop. This one costs three gold coins.

name: Fhyra’s Inferno
description: Dragons apply Pyregel 5 on Strike.
lore: A small effigy representing the mighty Fhyra, mother of the Pyreborne and whose rules all dragons must follow.

name: Flaming Talons
description: When an enemy unit ascends, they gain Pyregel 2.
lore: Said to be the talons of Fhyra herself, cut from her body during the first battle between Titans that ended with the first Pyre’s destruction.

name: Gel Transfusor
description: When any unit dies, their Pyregel is spread among enemy units.
lore: There are rumors amongst the whelps that if they don’t get their numbers up, Lady Gilda will shoot Pyregel in their veins to ‘put a little fire’ in them.

name: Golden Gloves
description: Friendly units gain Avarice 2.
lore:
“A gift for my shining dumpling after she kicked me out of our cave. I hope she likes the gloves. Or else she will not let me come home.”
—Lord Fenix

name: Hellfire Bellows
description: When a unit gains Pyregel, it gains +1 stacks.
lore: A mainstay tool used by the Pyreborne smelters. These bellows can withstand the hottest fires.

name: Hellheart
description: Apply Pyregel 10 to Non-Flying Boss enemy units that enter the floor below the Pyre Room.
lore: Before the Pyreborne became the greedy dragons they are now, they would channel their passions into rubies they wore around their necks.

name: Hidden Coffers
description: Increase max Dragon's Hoard by 2.
lore:
“You can tell a lot from a dragon’s treasure chest. An empty trove reveals an empty mind.”
—The Rules of Fhyra, Rule #14

name: Magma Core
description: Your Pyre applies Pyregel 2 to enemy units on all floors on Revenge.
lore: It is a rare occurrence but sometimes the lava that flows between the Pyreborne caves will solidify into a mass humming with power.

name: Medallion of Superiority
description: Units gain +3 Health and +3 Attack for each upgrade on their card.
lore: A trinket made of fool’s gold given to dragons who have proven supreme aptitude for business.

name: Prismatic Dragonscale
description: At the end of battle, gain 3 Dragon's Hoard if your Pyre took no damage.
lore:
“Never trust hard-earned riches, it’s the easy coin that will get you by.”
—The Rules of Fhyra, Rule #37

name: Pyreborne’s Insignia
description: When you equip a friendly unit, apply Conduit 4.
lore:
“Clients will always remember a great logo.”
—The Rules of Fhyra, Rule #98

name: Sacrificial Kris
description: Apply Pyregel 5 to enemy units when a Whelp dies.
lore: The temple priests carry a dagger they only use for one specific ritual: the sacrifice of unprofitable dragons to the great Fhyra.

name: Shaleshell
description: After using an ability, friendly units gain Armor 3.
lore: Fhyra wore such a shield during the battle of the First Pyre. Although she was consumed by her own flames, this part of her armor was somehow spared.

name: Sharpened Teeth
description: Dragons and Whelps gain +8 Attack.
lore: When a dragon loses their teeth from eating too much sweetened gold, such sharp dentures must be worn. They have become such a fashion statement among the elite Pyreborne.

name: Sizzling Firecracker
description: Spells gain +3 damage for each upgrade on their card.
lore: Although this product sounds cute, it’s enough to break into any vault along the Rail without destroying the gold inside.

name: Sparkflint Catalyst
description: When a unit without Pyregel gains Pyregel, it gains +6 stacks.
lore: A small but mighty weapon that might just give a dragon enough time to escape.

name: Spiritbreaker’s Charge
description: After using an ability, friendly units gain +5 Attack.
lore: A motivational tool used on dragons whose quarterly returns are deemed unacceptable.

name: Taskmaster’s Lash
description: When you damage your own unit, reduce Cooldown by 1.
lore:
“I love my adorable golden crumpet but when she snaps her whip she is terrifying!”
—Lord Fenix

name: The Dragonstone
description: Gain 1 Dragon's Hoard on the first turn of battle.
lore: Said to have been made from a scale from Fhyra herself, the Dragonstone brings prosperity to whichever dragon possesses it. If said dragon loses the stone, however, they face destitution.

name: A Forgotten Name
description: When you play your third spell of the turn, all cards gain +1 Magic Power for the rest of this battle.
lore: When we imprisoned the Titan for the safety of Hell, the Stygian Guard stripped it of its name. When the Titan is released again, its name will return with it.

name: Cuttlebeard
description: When a unit gains Frostbite, it gains +2 stacks. Frostbite does not decay.
lore: It seems that the energy of the Cuttlehex and the Molluscmages does not die with them, but continues to surge through their beards so long as they are kept intact. I’ve kept some of the beards with me. They’ve been quite useful, but the tentacles make me a tad squeamish.

name: Founding Seal
description: Incant triggers an additional time.
lore: Tethys and I created this Seal to commemorate the founding of the Stygian Guard and the protection they are sworn to give to their Unnamed Titan.

name: Icicle Fracture
description: At end of turn, apply Frozen to a random card in your hand.
lore: Ice created from the water of the Styx Sea melts at much higher temperatures than other ice I’ve found throughout Hell. Any icicles that form on the Boneshaker while in this Ring will not thaw entirely from the train’s residual heat, and will become potential hazards for negligent bystanders.

name: Kinstone Totem
description: When a card is discarded before the end of your turn, gain 1 Ember.
lore: For as long as I’ve lived in Hell, I’ve known the Ring filled with Bogwurm remains to be a desolate place with no sentient inhabitants. When Solgard mentioned a Kinstone gifted to him by a clan that resides there, the Wurmkin, I realized there’s so much I still don’t know about this place. Or, perhaps, I can no longer remember.

name: Rules of Containment
description: Enemy units enter with Frostbite 2.
lore: These ancient scrolls detail the laws of the Guard, from ceremonial offerings to mundane dress codes. They are a historical treasure trove that I look forward to studying more when this whole affair is finished.

name: Sigiled Seaweed
description: Apply Mute 1 when an enemy unit enters your train.
lore: The seaweed of the Sea is known to be very resistant to breaking. The addition of Stygian sigils make breaking it impossible, despite all my efforts.

name: Tethys’ Scales
description: 50% chance to apply Spell Weakness 1 when an enemy unit enters your train.
lore: As a symbolic sacrifice to convince her fellow sea dwellers of her commitment to the Covenant and the confinement of the Titan, Tethys removed her own scales. I don’t understand their ways, but the gesture worked as she intended.

name: Titan’s Claws
description: At end of turn, Frozen cards are reduced to 0 Ember until played or discarded.
lore: The sharp claws of the Titan. They were lodged into the stone as the Titan tried to escape prison we’d built for it. Now, they serve as a reminder of the strength we locked away.

name: Token of a Traitor
description: Playing a spell deals 2 damage to a random enemy unit on that floor.
lore: When the Covenant was formed, Seraph made a diplomatic offering to the Titan at my suggestion. It should have been telling that the pearl immediately turned black when the Traitor touched it.

name: Totem Fragment
description: Apply Spell Weakness 2 to enemy units when they enter the floor below the Pyre Room.
lore: From my studies of the Stygian totems, I’ve found that the sidestones that circle around them help to focus their energy. When removed from their totem host, these sidestones can produce a similar, though much weaker, effect on their target.

name: Abandoned Antumbra
description: At start of turn, add a common or uncommon Morsel unit to hand.
lore: I found this Morsel abandoned in the mines of the Crucible with all of its appendages missing. It seems to have taken a liking to me.

name: Chain of Gems
description: Apply Damage Shield 2 to the first friendly unit summoned each turn.
lore: I constructed this as a gift to Penumbra for his help with the Covenant. The necklace is made out of the finest gems found in the Crucible. For whatever reason, Penumbra tossed it aside, perhaps considering it too gaudy.

name: Commemorative Spike
description: At the start of battle, summon a Morsel Miner on each floor.
lore: Once the Rail was complete, I returned to the Crucible to enlist the Shroud’s help to create the Boneshaker. When the last bolt was punched into the train, they drove one last spike into the Rail to memorialize the train’s departure.

name: Fossilized Fangs
description: Gorge triggers an additional time.
lore: There are more victims in mine collapses than I would’ve first thought. Many Umbra have fallen victim to these accidents and while they fade back into the shadow, their teeth remain.

name: Mask of Penumbra
description: When you play your first Morsel unit each turn, draw 1.
lore: A discarded mask of the shadow known as Penumbra. I’ve encountered several of these throughout the mines. The shadow seems to outgrow them quickly.

name: Mine Jacks
description: +2 Capacity on the middle floor.
lore: These immense jacks are used to prevent the Crucible from collapsing. At the speed the Umbra seems to be mining it, I’m not sure these jacks will help it.

name: Refined Void
description: Friendly units enter with Lifesteal 2.
lore: While the Umbra doesn’t appear to become inebriated like other denizens of Hell, they’ve still taken to processing Void Shards into a liquid that mildly dulls the senses. When the Shroud consumes it, the drink makes them somewhat less unpleasant in my dealings with them.

name: Shadelamp
description: The first time each turn an enemy unit dies, add 2 Morsel units to hand.
lore: When the Rail was built, the Crucible became accessible to Hellborne other than the Umbra Shroud. The Shroud was not too welcoming, however, and crafted lights of shadow that only they could use to see, making it impossible for tourists to linger.

name: Shadowbox
description: When you play your 20th Morsel unit of the battle, deal 200 damage to enemy units on all floors.
lore: Supposedly, these crystal “Shardsouls” once contained sacrificed souls and were created by the Exiles in a gambit to save Heaven, Hell, and Human. Now empty, the crystal’s remains house many Morsels. This may confirm my theory that the Umbra Shroud is made of pure soul.

name: Teeth of Gold
description: Deal 5 damage to the back enemy unit when a unit is Eaten.
lore: On the rare occasion that a member of the Shroud has lost their teeth, sharp dentures are created from Crucible gems. Due to their high value, this has led to many Umbra intentionally removing their teeth.

name: Winged Technology
description: Morsel units enter with Damage Shield 1.
lore: For all their faults and treacherous tendencies, the Winged excel at developing new technology. Lucky for us, Antumbra Morsels were able to steal some of it for our collective benefit.

name: Ancient Roots
description: The first spell played each turn has -1 Ember for every 15 cards in your Deck.
lore: The roots of the Fatal Elm carve through the sand of Limbo, through the earth of Hell, past each circle until they reach the Ninth Forbidden Realm, and continue past into a world unknown to any being.

name: Cortical Connector
description: Shroom units gain Regen 1 on Harvest.
lore: The fungus that grows along the roots of the Fatal Elm is in fact one single neural network that consumes bodies and uses them for its own mysterious purpose.

name: Everchurning Soil
description: Draw +1 each turn per 25 cards in your Deck.
lore: On the eve of the Creation Elm’s destruction, the shroomfolk drink a mixture of soil taken from around the Fatal Elm mixed with water to remind themselves of what they have lost.

name: Evolutionary Instinct
description: When a unit has a third unique status effect applied to it, Propagate 2.
lore: The Fatal Elm is the source of life and from its branches new plants are born.

name: Sapsuckling Spring
description: Shroom units apply Decay 1 to enemy units on Summon.
lore: When the moons reach the rotten quadrant in the sky, the shroomfolk celebrate by drinking distilled sap from the trees.

name: Shroomponics
description: At start of turn, friendly units Propagate 1.
lore: When their forest was threatened by the Great Decay, the shroomfolk made this device to carry their young and keep them safe.

name: Spotted Spore
description: Funguy gain +2 Attack per Troop stack.
lore: Although the Underlegion fled their forest hoping to escape the Great Decay, they brought with them a few unwanted spores. One day, they might find a place to grow and I hope to never see that day.

name: Twin Minds
description: Create a permanent copy of the first Consume card played each battle.
lore:
“The two moved in unison, as if pulled by the invisible hands of a puppet master. Problem was, the two soldiers had long died on the battlefield.”
—The Archives of the Great Decay

name: Twisting Mycelium
description: On turn start Spawn 1 on each floor per 20 cards in your Deck.
lore:
“In moments, the clearing was overrun with the Decay and the bones that housed our children were lifted from the earth to feed the evil.”
—The Archives of the Great Decay

name: Verdant Cycle
description: The first time each turn a spell card with Consume is played, draw 1.
lore: Where the branches of the Fatal Elm reach beyond Heaven, a spore grows anew. Maybe this is a sign that this tree will become the Creation Elm once again.

name: World-ending Strain
description: When a unit dies to Decay, their Decay is spread among enemy units.
lore:
“We locked the Great Decay away and buried it beneath the roots of what was once the Creation Elm. May it never open or we are all doomed.”
—The Archives of the Great Decay

name: Ancient Pyretap
description: When you are out of Ember, cards can be played for their cost in Pyre Health.
lore: The Pyreborne, always looking to exact more than what can be given, found a gruesome method to collect Pyre magic: plunging a stake in the outer shell and installing a tap.

name: Artificial Pyrestone
description: +3 Deployment Ember.
lore: A trinket created to give a burst of Ember, unfortunately too unstable and expensive to be manufactured in bulk.

name: Attuned Whetstone
description: On Deployment Phase, draw an Equipment card from your deck. Reduce its cost to 0 Ember.
lore: As I sharpened the blades of clan soldiers, I wondered if I would ever see them again. Quartz absorbs the emotions around it and soon my whetstone absorbed my wishes for the safety of my friends.

name: Blank Pages
description: At start of turn, if you do not have a Champion in your hand, add a random one to your hand.
lore: Times are changing. Divinities are making rules while we keep trying to save our own skins. Well, not anymore. There’s more souls out there who can help us, there’s got to be. And it’s about time someone set out to find them. So, I guess, this is where I’ll try and record that search. I’ll bet old Herzal’s turning in his ice at the thought. Don’t worry, I fail like the best of ‘em.

name: Boiler Room Mod
description: At the start of battle, apply Boiler Room on the first floor.
lore: Trains don’t run on dreams and wishes. Behind every sheet of metal is an intricately engineered piece of work.

name: Bone Dog’s Pendant
description: The first time the Pyre reaches 0 health, restore the Pyre to 25% health. This can only trigger once.
lore: Although I was not able to give much to this pup, I tried to give him love. I hope whenever he hears the clink of his collar’s tag, he’ll be reminded of all the fun we had.

name: Breath of Heaven
description: Advance the back enemy unit when it enters your train.
lore: When Angels and Demons were created, they were given the Breath of Life. Over time, Seraph manipulated this innate ability in all beings so that it became a powerful force that knocks an enemy back.

name: Canio
description: When you Purge a card outside of combat, gain 75 Gold.
lore: “Laugh, Clown at your broken love! Laugh at the grief that poisons your heart!”

name: Capricious Reflection
description: Cards in reward packs and unit banners come with a random upgrade.
lore: Waters touched by fragments of the lost Divinities show us reflections of another world. A world where the Divine Mother governed over the creation of life and the responsibility of death. Given the purview of her powers, it follows that her destruction created the many immortal beings of Heaven and Hell and led to our current predicament.

name: Cavendish
description: Non-champion friendly units gain 3x base Attack. After each round of combat, 1% chance for this artifact to be destroyed.
lore: “That other banana wasn’t very a-peel-ing, was it?”

name: Chicot
description: Bosses start with Mute 3.
lore: “I am craven, and thou art my master.”

name: Cleansing Water
description: 50% chance to remove all Buff effects on an enemy unit when it enters your train.
lore: During my time in Heaven, I was gifted some of their purifying water, but the liquid was so strong that it would burn anything it touched. So, I put it aside. It has now found a new use as a repellant in the Boneshaker.

name: Crown of the Eternal
description: At start of turn, fully heal Champions.
lore: The queen who once wore this crown is long gone but her magic still rests within its glittering gems.

name: Dante's Candelabra
description: The Pyre gains Titanskin 2.
lore: Dante’s candles burn as hot as the Pyre itself, yet his candelabra makes the heat somehow bearable. Always been a man of many mysteries.

name: Dante's Footstool
description: On Deployment Phase, draw a Room card from your deck. Reduce its cost to 0 Ember.
lore: A strange object that somehow always seems to appear in a room before Dante himself.

name: Deepwood Oil
description: Equipped units gain Armor 10.
lore: Long ago, young demons ventured into the Wild Woods and dipped their blades in the forest rivers. Their reward for their bravery was a blade that would never break.

name: Divine Shard
description: Your Pyre gets 25 Health.
lore: Heaven and Hell thought that the Last Divinity would be the last of the Titans... hence the name they called it. They were, unfortunately, quite wrong.

name: Emot Tome
description: Create an Ephemeral copy of the first spell you play each turn.
lore: A historical account of the great battles between Heaven and Hell before the Covenant. Written in the back is a first hand account from a demon about the first days after the Covenant was broken.

name: Fight Club Mod
description: At the start of battle, apply Fight Club on the third floor.
lore: The first trains weren’t built for warfare, they were meant to connect the people of Heaven and Hell together. But now, the trains have been fully outfitted as war machines.

name: Golden Idol
description: Trial Gold rewards are increased by 50%.
lore: A shining visage of the Titan of Savagery. Some wish to see it melted for scrap while others advocate turning it against its progenitor.

name: Gros Michel
description: Non-champion friendly units gain +10 Attack. After each round of combat, 10% chance for this artifact to be destroyed.
lore: “Peel my wrath!”

name: Guild Marker
description: Merchant costs are reduced by 25%.
lore: Despite my several attempts to win the support of the furry traders, the merchants of Hell have decided to stay neutral. Finally, after much pestering, they allowed me into their guild. That hasn’t stopped them from wringing me of any spare coin.

name: Heaven’s Light
description: +2 Capacity on each floor. Your Pyre gets +[effect2.pyreattackpower]Attack and +[effect1.pyrehealthpower][pyrehealth].
lore: The coveted Light of Seraph. Those from above worship it as much as we value the Pyre. From what I’ve seen it’s powerful, sure, but it’s not as special as they say. That doesn’t mean I won’t take some if given the chance.

name: Heaven’s Light
description: +2 Capacity on each floor. Your Pyre gets +[effect2.pyreattackpower]Attack and +[effect1.pyrehealthpower][pyrehealth].
lore: The coveted Light of Seraph. Those from above worship it as much as we value the Pyre. From what I’ve seen it’s powerful, sure, but it’s not as special as they say. That doesn’t mean I won’t take some if given the chance.

name: Hell’s Flame
description: +1 Ember per turn. +1 Deployment Ember. Your Pyre gets +[effect2.pyreattackpower]Attack and +[effect1.pyrehealthpower][pyrehealth].
lore: When Fel left to join her cause, she left me with remaining Embers of the Pyre. She could have been killed for this, but she gave them anyway. That’s all I have to say about Fel.

name: Hell’s Flame
description: +1 Ember per turn. +1 Deployment Ember. Your Pyre gets +[effect2.pyreattackpower]Attack and +[effect1.pyrehealthpower][pyrehealth].
lore: When Fel left to join her cause, she left me with remaining Embers of the Pyre. She could have been killed for this, but she gave them anyway. That’s all I have to say about Fel.

name: Historian's Razor
description: Friendly units get +10 Attack but -1 Attack for every non-boss Artifact you own.
lore: The recording of history can be much more speculative than one might think, for even the most objective historians. When it is up to a historian’s imagination, the simplest explanations are the most likely to have occurred.

name: Hope for Peace
description: Spells and Equipment with Purge have Consume instead.
lore: As elusive as their name, these bright flowers bloom briefly in the cracked soil of the Scorched Plains, quickly smothered by the harsh environment.

name: Jackstrips
description: Deal 3 Piercing damage whenever an enemy unit moves between floors.
lore: The stairwells of the Boneshaker are never what they seem. Among other surprises, the hidden spike traps I’ve engineered can be set to stop any combatant.

name: Kwilling Catcher
description: At the end of the entire battle, gain 100 Gold.
lore: A nifty net with traces of gold-lit orbs gathered inside. They’d probably fetch a pretty penny.

name: Large Mystery Box
description: Add a random card to your hand each turn.
lore: What’s inside?

name: Leaky Pen
description: -1 Ember per turn. Draw 2 additional cards per turn.
lore: An antique pen whose owner must have held the pen too tight, for it now leaks ink everywhere.

name: Lightstone Casing
description: Spells get an extra upgrade slot.
lore: After the Pyrestone brace proved to be wildly successful, Seraph stole my design and created a similar device to infuse the stones with Light instead. As is his way, he created a housing much more ostentatious than the simple one I created for Hell.

name: Limbo’s Solace
description: Draw +1 each turn. Your Pyre gets +[effect2.pyreattackpower]Attack and +[effect1.pyrehealthpower][pyrehealth].
lore: One of my crowning achievements. A metal-based compound that can be formed into any shape. I’ve only been able to create a small batch of it, but a little goes a long way.

name: Limbo’s Solace
description: Draw +1 each turn. Your Pyre gets +[effect2.pyreattackpower]Attack and +[effect1.pyrehealthpower][pyrehealth].
lore: One of my crowning achievements. A metal-based compound that can be formed into any shape. I’ve only been able to create a small batch of it, but a little goes a long way.

name: Looming Darkshard
description: When you draw a Blight or Scourge, gain 1 Ember and draw a non-Blight or non-Scourge card.
lore: Sometimes a curse can be a blessing in disguise. While Hell is filled with so many opportunities for pain, they often make a demon stronger.

name: Lost Luggage
description: On the turn after Deployment Phase, draw until you have 10 cards.
lore: Contrary to common belief, demons do not travel light. Supposedly, the souls of Heaven and Hell require less worldly attachments than the Humans they consider to be so lowly, but I can tell you that is absolutely untrue. I once saw a Hellhorned Demon bring aboard six bursting suitcases. When I asked if all of it was needed, the Demon only glared and growled. Only then, have I truly known fear.

name: Manifold Mirror
description: The first Room card played each battle is applied to all floors.
lore: A mirror that reflects not only who you are but who you wish to be.

name: Nim's Oath
description: At start of turn, apply Dazed 1 to the front enemy unit on a random floor.
lore: These shattered orbs were called ‘Bindings’ and still contains a trace of its power. One thing is for certain, this item is not of this world.

name: Odi's Totem
description: +1 Ember per turn. -3 Deployment Ember.
lore: This statuette has the uncanny ability of following its owner with its eyes wherever they go.

name: Perkeo
description: At the start of battle, gain a Calcified Ember that converts to Excavated Ember after not playing it once.
lore: “Why so serious?”

name: Purified Soul Shard
description: Unit cards without upgrades cost -1 Ember.
lore: What happens to the souls trapped within soul shards? No one is sure. There are cases of shards becoming ‘purified’, a transformation denoted by a change in color.

name: Pyreforged Flame
description: +1 Ember per turn. +1 Deployment Ember. Your Pyre gets +[effect2.pyreattackpower]Attack and +[effect1.pyrehealthpower][pyrehealth].

name: Pyreforged Light
description: +2 Capacity on each floor. Your Pyre gets +[effect2.pyreattackpower]Attack and +[effect1.pyrehealthpower][pyrehealth].

name: Pyreforged Solace
description: Draw +1 each turn. Your Pyre gets +[effect2.pyreattackpower]Attack and +[effect1.pyrehealthpower][pyrehealth].

name: Pyrestone Housing
description: Units get an extra upgrade slot.
lore: My discovery of the creation of Pyrestones, gemstones infused with flames of the Pyre, was monumental in enhancing the strength of Hell’s forces and marked a turning point in the war against Heaven. That victory was short-lived, however, as the design was stolen and copied shortly thereafter.

name: Shadow's Sheath
description: Friendly units gain Stealth 1 on Summon and Slay. +3 Attack per stack of Stealth.
lore: They say Death himself walks beside the rail, and that is not a figure of speech. Though none have said it for long.

name: Shattered Halo
description: Clan card drafts only offer rares.
lore: A general of heaven long forgotten once possessed this halo, up until their sudden defeat they were said to have uncommonly good luck.

name: Sinner's Salve
description: Blights and Scourges cost 0 Ember.
lore: Collaboration between the Rings of Hell was rare, but the few that did occur produced wondrous results. Water from the Stygian Sea blessed by the Channelers of the Wildwood created a solution capable of soothing the pains of Heaven’s wretched sinner contraptions. However, this was used only a handful of times. Those contraptions rarely had survivors...

name: Sketches of Salvation
description: After the Deployment Phase, summon a random unit from your deck on each floor.
lore: There was little time to act after Seraph’s invasion, but there was just enough for me to design a way to protect what would remain of the Pyre after its inevitable destruction.

name: Spell Sanctum Mod
description: At the start of battle, apply Spell Sanctum on the second floor.
lore: With her father’s Boneshaker, Heph didn’t want to change any of the original designs. But with her own trains, she was willing to build wherever her imagination took her.

name: Split Anvil
description: When you play a spell, spells in hand that cost less are reduced to 0 Ember for the turn.
lore: After completing the Rail, I destroyed the anvil I used to create all the Railspikes as a symbolic ending to this endeavor.

name: The Clepsydranium
description: Friendly units gain Conduit 1 on Slay.
lore: A ‘water clock’ filled with ink instead of water. The ink inside sloshes as if it had a mind of its own.

name: Traitor’s Quill
description: When a card with Consume is played, deal 30 damage to the front enemy unit.
lore: Seraph was not always the Traitor he is today, hellbent on the unification of Heaven and Hell for our mutual survival. He was the main reason the Covenant was pursued to begin with. I suppose his need for control finally got the better of him...

name: Triboulet
description: Friendly units gain +3 Health for each rare card in your deck.
lore: “Jesters do oft prove prophets.”

name: Unstable Pyresparks
description: Train Steward units gain the Boom Ability.
lore: I did not just create the Stewards to aid me. They also contain a hidden defense mechanism that triggers if the Forge is attacked. I hope to never have to use them but, if I must, I am prepared.

name: Unstable Shard
description: Friendly units get +5 Attack and +12 Health.
lore: When the Last Divinity died, the divine shards scattered across all of Heaven and Hell. Fragments of those shards still remain, cackling with latent divine energy.

name: Versatile Emberstaff
description: When you play three different kinds of cards in a turn, draw 1 and gain 1 Ember.
lore: To guide Dante in his descent through Hell, Beatrice gifted him a staff infused by her angelic hands to guide him.

name: Vola's Tuning Fork
description: Starter cards cost -1 Ember.
lore: Her celestial song was said to be sweet enough to bring peace to a battlefield. Some still hold out hope that she will one day return.

name: Volatile Gauge
description: When you draw any non-Champion card, its cost is randomized between 0 Ember and 3 Ember. Draw +2 each turn.
lore: One of the first instruments I developed for the Boneshaker. Regrettably, it’s not very accurate and delivers entirely random heat output from the furnace.

name: Wanderer's Talisman
description: At start of turn, friendly units gain +5 Attack and +5 Health if they are the only friendly unit on the floor.
lore: A token from better times, found in Limbo without its owner.

name: Wing Clippings
description: Spell cards with Consume have a 50% chance to be discarded instead.
lore: Clipped Wings are discarded after removal to suppress any hope of the victim’s redemption. However, I was able to smuggle some out of Heaven disguised as Waxer rags.

name: Winged Steel
description: After Deployment Phase, when you play your third card of the turn, draw 1.
lore: The Winged crafted a solid piece of steel to show me the creation process. The runes they placed on it made sure I could not melt it down again for my own use.

name: Wolo's Bloodletter
description: Friendly units get +12 Attack. Deal 1 damage to friendly units each turn.
lore: Whoever once owned this must have had an incredible pain tolerance, as wearing it would feel like enduring countless papercuts at every moment.

name: Yorick
description: When a card with Consume is played, gain 25 Gold.
lore: “Alas, poor Yorick! I knew him, Horatio; a fellow of infinite jest.”
